page.title: 18Nature Reserve Waverton.
page.content: This reserve on the banks of the Gowy at Hockenhull Plattes,is one of the last remaining alder carr or wetland sites in the area.It's leased to the Cheshire Conservation Trust by the Grosvenor Estate and is managed by Head and pupils of Christleton Primary School.Annual records and census returns monitor species ,are made for CCTrust and the BTO Common Bird Census The fauna is rich and contains Common Spotted Orchid,Purple Orchid,Ragged robin,Lady Smock,Wild Arum and Marsh Marigold.There are many grasses,reeds and flowering rushes.It has excellent habitats for hare,stoat,shrew,vole,and mole whilst fox and badger are regular visitors.20species of Butterflies and 5species of Dragon and damsel flies are found each year.The pond is a major habitat for frogs,toads,newts.40 species of spiders have been recorded.
